Figure 35. Critical values of the relativistic potential ˆVR plotted in units of Mtotc2 (here set equal to
3) as a function of a given particle mass mj. The maximum critical value occurs in the case when
mj = Mtot/2. As mj →0 or Mtot, the minimal value ˆVR →Mtot is attained.
The overall shape of the R potential is that of a distorted hexagonal carafe, whose
distortion is analogous to that of the N potential, as shown in Figure 36. The relatively
steeper growth of the R potential as a function of distance from the origin is manifest by
the smaller scales for ρ and λ in the right-hand panel.
